de.akuz.osynce.macro.serial.payloads
Class AbstractPayload

java.lang.Object
  de.akuz.osynce.macro.serial.payloads.AbstractPayload
All Implemented Interfaces:
Payload
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbstractFixedLengthPayload, AbstractVariableLengthPayload, TrainingsList
public abstract class AbstractPayload
extends java.lang.Object
implements Payload

Abstract class which represents Payloads contained in packets. This class provides some methods to write into a byte array provided by extending classes. Please note that, if the byte array returned by getBytes() isn't the actual data structure that hold the payload, these method have to be overwritten

Author:
Till Klocke

Method Detail

writeBytesToData

public void writeBytesToData(byte[] value,
                             int byteOffset,
                             int offset,
                             int length)
Writes a byte array into the byte array holding the payload. The least significant byte is written first. This can throw NullPointerExceptions or ArrayOutOfBoundsExceptions.

Parameters:
value - byte array with least significant byte at last position
byteOffset - offset from which bytes are used if the bytearray
offset - offset of the payload or starting address
length - how much data should be written

writeBytesToData

public void writeBytesToData(byte[] value,
                             int offset,
                             int length)
Writes a byte array into the byte array holding the payload

Parameters:
value - the byte array to be written, with LSB last
offset - the offset or address of the position in the payload
length - how much data should be written

writeByteToData

public void writeByteToData(byte value,
                            int offset)
Writes a single byte to the specified position

Parameters:
value - the byte to be written
offset - the position in the payload

getBytesFromPosition

public byte[] getBytesFromPosition(int position,
                                   int count)
returns a byte array from the payload, starting at the specified position

Parameters:
position - which is the first byte of the returned array
count - how much data should be read
Returns:
byte array containing the specified subset

getByteFromPosition

public byte getByteFromPosition(int position)
Returns the byte at the specified position

Parameters:
position - position in the payload
Returns:
the byte at that position
